thread.title: women's basketball game vs. Middle Tennessee to air on ASN
thread.title_full: UAB women's basketball game vs. Middle Tennessee to air on ASN | AL.com

author: UAB Athletics Media Relations
title: women's basketball game vs. Middle Tennessee to air on ASN
text:
UAB's women's basketball game vs. Middle Tennessee, originally scheduled for Feb. 20, 2016, will be moved to Feb. 21 and be televised live on the American Sports Network (ASN), the Conference USA office announced Thursday.
"We take great pride in the opportunities we have to showcase our university, our program and our league," head coach Randy Norton said. "We look forward to a big matchup Feb. 21 against one of the top teams in C-USA and the nation."
The announcement comes as part of C-USA's continuing partnership with ASN, as the network will broadcast a total of 80 league basketball games (65 men's, 15 women's) throughout the 2015-16 campaign.
The matchup between the Blazers and Blue Raiders will tip at 12 p.m. on Feb. 21. UAB will also appear on national TV on Jan. 10 at UTEP on Fox Sports Network.
The Blazers' 2015-16 slate opens Nov. 13 at Auburn, and includes a Thanksgiving trip to Cancun, Mexico for the Cancun Challenge, plus matchups versus South Alabama, Troy, Samford, Florida State and an 18-game C-USA Schedule.
UAB returns three starters from last year's squad, a group that went 11-7 in league play, the best finish for the Blazers since the 2006-07 season. It also marked just the second time since 1993-94 that the Blazers won 11 conference games.
UAB returns 10 players overall from last season's unit, including seven seniors and four players who will be competing in their fourth season. Four newcomers, two freshmen and two transfers will all be suiting up in a Blazer uniform for the first time and be eligible to play in the 2015-16 campaign.
Get your UAB women's basketball season tickets today by calling the UAB Athletic Ticket office at (205) 975-UAB1 (205-975-8221), or by clicking here .
Women's basketball individual season tickets are just $50 for UAB's 16 home games and single-game tickets run $5 for adults and $3 for youth (ages 6-17). All children ages five and under are admitted free, and UAB students also receive free admission with a valid I.D.
The Blazers and the City of Birmingham will serve as host to the Conference USA Tournament for the second year in a row, March 8-12, at the Legacy Arena. Tickets for the conference tournament are priced at $250 for Premium seats, $180 for mid-court, $100 for Baseline.
ASN is an initiative of the Sinclair Networks Group, LLC, which owns and operates, programs and provides sales services to 164 television stations in 79 markets, reaching approximately 43 million U.S. television households. It includes FOX, ABC, CBS, MyTV, CW, NBC, Univision and Azteca affiliates. ASN, which launched in August 2014, produced 250 college events in nine sports in its first year and plans to air more than 375 events in the 2015-16 academic year.
